New_York.Grand Theatre (Manhattan):
The Grand Theatre was a theatre in the Yiddish Theater District in Manhattan in New York City built for Yiddish productions, the first of its kind.


== Background ==
On March 12, 1902, Sophia Karp, with Jacob Fischel and playwright Joseph Lateiner, founded the Grand Theatre in New York City. The city's first theatre built specifically for Yiddish productions, the Grand was typical of Yiddish theatres of the time by being largely artist-managed.
